meanings.definition: Making someone feel happier or more hopeful.
meanings.sent1: The uplifting music put a smile on her face.
meanings.sent2: The movie had an uplifting message about never giving up.
meanings.sent3: The uplifting story of the clumsy puppy learning to dance made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words were like an uplifting breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise over the mountains was truly uplifting, filling her with joy.

meanings.definition: Raising something to a higher position.
meanings.sent1: She used a ladder to start uplifting the heavy boxes onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers were uplifting the beams to build the new house.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved magically uplifting the cards into the air.
meanings.sent4: The crane was used for uplifting the massive sculpture into place.
meanings.sent5: The balloon slowly began uplifting into the sky, carrying their hopes with it.

meanings.definition: A feeling of happiness or hope.
meanings.sent1: The uplifting she felt after the good news was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to share in the uplifting of spirits.
meanings.sent3: His joke had an unexpected uplifting effect on the somber mood.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the rainbow brought an uplifting to their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project brought an uplifting to the entire team.
